title: Chapter 13 personal bankruptcy and owner of S corp
question: My husband and I will be filing a personal chapter 13 bk and own an S corp that incurred a loss for 2008. We also have our normal w-2 jobs. When stating income and expenses on Schedules I and J, would we need to put the income and expenses from the corporation even though we have no profit?
answers:
Please do not embark on a Chapter 13 case by yourself. Hiring a competent lawyer can save you a lot of time, money and hassle.

As far as the substance of your question, I practice with an important caveat: When in doubt, fully disclose. I can always argue whether the information I've disclosed is pertinent or insist on my view of how it should impact a case, but leaving out income entirely is a strategy fraught with peril and one that I avoid at all costs.

I would also include all business debts and contractual obligations as well. It is not uncommon for small business owners to forget they signed a lease or other agreement with a personal guarantee. You want absolutely everyone notified to make sure all personal obligations are fully discharged at the end of your case.

Good luck.
